snippet: A federal judge in California announced a $30 million settlement that requires Teodoro Nguema Obiang Mangue to forfeit his assets, including a collection of six life-size statues of Michael Jackson.
abstract: Federal judge in California announces $30 million settlement between United States and Teodoro Nguema Obiang Mangue, a vice president of Equatorial Guinea, accused of corruption and money laundering; settlement requires Obiang to forfeit his assets in US.
lead_paragraph: A federal judge in California announced a $30 million settlement that requires Teodoro Nguema Obiang Mangue to forfeit his assets, including a collection of six life-size statues of Michael Jackson.

headline.main: Equatorial Guinea: A Vice President Is Ordered to Forfeit Assets in the U.S.
headline.print_headline: Equatorial Guinea: A Vice President Is Ordered to Forfeit Assets in the U.S.
